subject: Re: JUnit 4 restructuring
msgSnippet: I m sorry for repeating myself but I fear that my last message (http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/15268) might have been overlooked. What do the
messageBody:
I'm sorry for repeating myself but I fear that my last message
(http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/15268) might have been
overlooked.

What do the people who haven't yet responded think about
@Before/@BeforeClass vs. @BeforeTest/@BeforeSuite? Please, give us
your comments. Nothing will happen if you don't speak your mind!


What is the overall opinion about Joe Walnes' aproach to flexible
JUnit assertions using assertThat? Do you think it is better or worse
than the current assertions? I would like to have it included in the
new release, would you too? David, why do you think using constraints
is heavy weight?


And why
1) does junit.framework.Assert still define assertEquals for
boolean, int, long etc. (autoboxing could do that; in fact, deleting
those methods doesn't produce any errors)?
2) isn't java.lang.AssertionError used instead of
junit.framework.AssertionFailedError?
